Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: cycletour
Reviews.Content: This dingy hotel is across from a hospital, so you hear sirens all night long. Our toilet didn't flush, and we weren't given toilet paper. The hotel smelled, and the room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than expected”
Reviews.Author: dagima
Reviews.Content: After reading Tripadvisor advices, I expected something bad. After beeing there I can confirm that the only positive aspects are the central location and the low prices. The building is narrow (Hotel?) and really decadent. Most of the furniture is decrepit. Torn curtains, broken tils, hydraulic parts rusty ... No possbility to have breakfast. I wouldn't recommend this Hotel unless for a very short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price, great location, fully functional budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Livia_Cannes
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights here and we were pleasantly surprised. Its a great location to discover London. Only a short walk to the Tube station or several bus stops. Quiet at night (!) but close to a lively shopping street with plenty of good and affordable places to eat. Our double room had its own en suite facilities. Also the kettle with tea and coffee were a nice touch. True, the building looks a bit neglected and the furniture is a little old but the room was ample sized, clean and fully functional. Excellent value for money indeed. If you don't plan to stay lots of time in the hotel, than this perfectly adequate and the price is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - very poor building condition, service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTravel100
Reviews.Content: Pubic hair in the toilet and bathroom, hair on the bed covers, dilapidated state and noisy - this hotel is NOT what it seems from the website and pictures. The location is great - given that the value for money (£69 for a double) seemed too good to be true. Well, it was. Shockingly, there was no manager on duty overnight until lunch time the next day - leaving the running of the hotel and safety of its inhabitants, in the hands of one polite but overburdened young receptionist. Don't let the website fool you - you'd be much better off in a really good hostel. Wish I'd checked tripadvisor before booking!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Businessvisi2r
Reviews.Content: I could hardly believe it was a hotel when I arrived - it was part of a derelict block and the ground floor bar was disused. The entrance staircase stank of damp and mould and the untidy girl who opened the door led me to a junk filled 'reception' room, little more than a filthy cupboard, to check in. The carpets were threadbare and stained and the corridor looked as if it had been painted by a chimpanzee. My room smelt of drains, the toilet seat was loose and there was mould in the bathroom. Much worse, and dangerous, was the bedside light with its bare wires. The window had been wedged open, and when I asked about it, the reply was 'oh, we needed to get some air in there'. (I was not surprised - the place stank). I was worried for my safety as there was a fire escape directly outside, but she told me they had 'never had any trouble'. Er - this is London - I do not exactly feel safe in such a dump as this with a window I cannot shut. Breakfast was served, late, in the derelict pub, by a rude young girl who could not be bothered to hurry a yard. There was no heating, the place was covered in dust and I did not want to touch anything, so I walked out. Later, I went to get my luggage to move to another hotel and by 4.30pm, the room still had not been cleaned. A filthy rat-hole of a place with poor service. I don't care how cheap it is - if it isn't safe or clean then it is worth nothing. Don't stay there. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for some”
Reviews.Author: Diann744
Reviews.Content: I read many conflicting reviews here before booking the Chelsea Lodge Hotel for my recent trip to London. One post would say, â€œthe rooms were filthy,â€� while the very next insisted that â€œat least everything was spotlessly clean.â€� Hereâ€™s my take, and yes, it is a positive review, you just have to keep reading: My group booked three rooms for three nights. We ended up only staying for one as some of the inconveniences were too difficult for us. We knew that it was a multi-story hotel with no elevator and so requested rooms on the lower floors. We received two rooms on the second and one on the third, which was much what we expected. Nicola, the woman who seems to run the place almost single-handedly, was a gem and actually handled the bulk of carrying our bags to our rooms as we were (a) tired and (b) stereotypical Americans who are unused to stairs much less stairs when encumbered with 50 pound suitcases. The whole place is a bit careworn, with bald spots on the carpets and peeling wallpaper. However, that can easily be dismissed (by most) as charming. My main worry, from the reviews Iâ€™d read, was cleanliness. There were things that could have been cleaner (door jambs, light switches, windows) but the things that matter most to me (shower, toilet, bedding) were immaculate. Nicola was always there and eager to do anything to make her guests happy. While waiting for our rooms to be cleaned, we adjourned to the first floor pub which has also seen better days and seems to be held together with duct tape. However, the bartender, whose name I didnâ€™t catch, was every bit as solicitous as Nicola, and instantly made the â€œAmericans â€“ they want ice with everythingâ€� connection. We checked out early mainly because of difficulties with communication. Our cell phones didnâ€™t work there and we were unable to make the in-room phones work for us so coordinating things was a bit tough. (One of our rooms had a toilet that needed a secret code to flush but thatâ€™s another story.) We ended up finding a hotel down the street that had wifi and a restaurant and was better suited to our needs but for the traveler who is a bit more adventurous, more self-sufficient, this hotel is a low-price, clean where it counts, customer service oriented find. I especially loved the fact that when we told Nicola we were checking out early, she never asked why, just checked us out with a smile, picked up a suitcase and started down the stairs before thanking us and wishing us a safe journey. Upshot â€“ not right for me but absolutely perfect for many travelers looking for an inexpensive, quirky London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Loud”
Reviews.Author: pennyKansas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Chelsea Lodge because it was on Arthur Frommer's recommendations and we were thoroughly dissapointed. We didn't mind that the rooms were small but we did mind that it was very filthy. There were curry stains on the wall, the comforter had multiple stains, and the bathroom had not been cleaned (there were hairs on the floor). We were in London for 3 days and they came in to "clean" only 1 of those days. We loved London but tried to stay away from our room as much as possible. The area is actually a very nice area and we regret not paying a little more to stay at hotels in that same area that appeared better than ours. There are 2 hospitals nearby so sleeping at night was hard. Kansas, USA

Reviews.Title: “A solid deal...”
Reviews.Author: Pinkflamenco
Reviews.Content: I read about this property on BudgetTravel.com, and do think it's one of the better budget properties I've stayed in visiting Europe. You're simply not going to find any kind of luxury for under $200/night in London--but if you're like me, a young person just looking for a place to sleep and shower, you could do much worse than the Chelsea Lodge Hotel. The staff is nice, if really busy. The rooms are sufficiently clean, and the amenities sufficient. The common spaces are pretty run down, and the decor mismatching, but it's a solid deal. The breakfast isn't what they make it out to be, however, so if you're looking for a good English breakfast (more than toast and cereal--and trust me, you want eggs, beans and mushrooms while you're in the UK!), you'll need to head down the street. It is located within walking distance of a tube stop, and the high-street shopping, only about two blocks away, is great. I did have my credit card run twice accidentally, so be sure you're clear with the staff how you want to pay when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: haley413
Reviews.Content: Rooms where extremely dirty. Didn't look like they had a good clean in years. I was afraid to get into the shower as it was so discoloured. Bed had no springs, and again we were afraid to sleep in it. Had to use blankets we had bought to use on the plane. Apparently the building is for sale. I can only assume the present owners think that it well sell better dirty. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Rude”
Reviews.Author: JewelsDublin
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked in here having read the reviews on TripAdvisore for seeing the Chelsea Flower Show in 2006. When we arrived we were led up a filthy stairs which smelled of smoke, our room had not yet been cleaned. The tiles were coming off the wall in the shower, there was no edging around the sink-just uncovered chip board and thus covered in germs. The curtains which were supposed to be white were now grey. There were stains on our carpet and on out bed spread. When we complained,the owner accused us of trying to get a freebie and that if we didnt like it we could move out. We tried to find accommodation but everywhere was booked out. That night when we returned to the accommodation, we were greeted by the blaring disco which continued until 2am in the morning. Also beware the breakfast which is served in the pub which smells of smoke and dirt. This year for the flower show we booked into a 5* hotel. We left Chelsea Lodge after one night and slept in a hotel beside the airport

Reviews.Title: “Still a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As we stayed here two years ago and I was pleased with it at the time we decided to stay here again for another weekend. The hotel is still a good option if you're on a budget. The pub has gone and been replaced by a french bistro. The place still offers value for money. There are 3 buses stopping just outside the hotel and you're near Harrods within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Aretz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Wimbledon two years ago and for what you pay for it you get great value. Prices include (simple) breakfast served in the pub downstairs. The pub can cause some noise on weekends. Taking the buss (there's a stop just outside the hotel) to the city centre takes about 15 minutes, or walk (10 minutes) to the tubestation down the road. Would defenitly recommend this hotel considering it's value for money

HotelInfo.Name: Chelsea Lodge Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 268 Fulham Road | Chelsea, London SW109EW, England
